metadata.synopsis: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I've got some explosive powder. That might clear the debris.

58.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
58.text: You got those boots? Or something else eatin' at you?

91.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
91.text: Brithvar's dead. I - I proved myself. No way Nere can doubt me now.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Nere isn't happy. These gnomes better start digging faster.

41.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
41.text: My arm's near dead from the lashing. The prick-squeaks are digging as fast as I can make them!

116.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
116.text: I'm splittin' for Moonrise Towers. It's time the General made me a True Soul.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Nere spoke to me; our minds connected. And he's not happy.
86.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Is this how you welcome a True Soul?
107.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: A few of your clanmates are plotting to kill Nere.
139.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

5.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
5.text: Let me guess - Brithvar and Kur. They've been a thorn in my arse since Nere hired us.

120.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
120.text: Ignore dumb and dumber. They'd jump down a well if they though there was gold at the bottom.

30.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
30.text: Nere can handle himself. Reason I joined - I know which way the lava flows.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I heard a gnome fled the dig. What happened?
11.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

110.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
110.text: Drugnin' shitshow, it was. Couple of pricklets figured they'd blow us clear to the topland.
110.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

153.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
153.text: Nere caught 'em scheming. Handed a few to an escort - dragged to Moonrise, is my guess.
153.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

173.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
173.text: But one pudge got ballsy, set off a blast and skittered away in the ruckus. And we still haven't found her.
173.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Moonrise? We're nearing the Towers. We're nearing answers.
40.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: Moonrise? We're nearing the Towers. We're nearing answers.
146.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.text: Moonrise? There's a lot resting on what we find in that place. It had better deliver.
15.context: NodeContext: Discreet reference to Nere, whose head we're to collect as a bounty.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: An escort to Moonrise, huh? Can't be too far off, then.
129.context: NodeContext: Forced levity - a side-glance at the player referencing that we're actually here to kill Nere, not save him.

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: The Towers must be close. And finding Moonrise means finding answers.
130.context: NodeContext: Forced levity - a side-glance at the player referencing that we're actually here to kill Nere, not save him.

109.speaker: Wyll
109.text: Moonrise? We're closing in on the Towers. And the curse...
109.context: NodeContext: Forced levity - a side-glance at the player referencing that we're actually here to kill Nere, not save him.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: Moonrise. We're getting close to the lion's den - and plenty of questions I have for the lion, too.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I noticed an orb floating about. What's it doing?
42.context: InternalNodeContext: Tagged as not REALLY_GNOME to prevent multiple similar options

168.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
168.text: Scrying eye. Nere says the Absolute's scryers see through 'em. Watching. Judging.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'd like to know more about Moonrise.
68.context: NodeContext: Thrinn is a bit surprised but shrugs it off

149.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
149.text: You don't know about the seat of the Absolute? No doubt you'll see it for yourself soon enough.
149.context: NodeContext: Thrinn is a bit surprised but shrugs it off

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Who is operating the scrying eye I've seen floating around?

87.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
87.text: That's Moonrise, keeping tabs. Nere says they've scryers watching the Absolute's followers for trouble, non-stop.

156.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
156.text: Heat up some rocks. Let's see how the little pricks do when we strap fire to their legs.

93.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
93.text: Charming. Hell is truly where we make it.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Charming. Hell is truly where we make it.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Charming. Hell is truly where we make it.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You the one Greymon mentioned? Heard you killed that thievin' gnome. Where's my boots?

52.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
52.text: You the one Greymon mentioned? Heard you killed that thievin' gnome. Where's my boots?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Forget the boots. I'm here to check on the dig.
22.context: NodeContext: DRUG-nin (means fucking, as an expletive)

132.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
132.text: Forget them? What drugnin' game are you -
132.context: NodeContext: DRUG-nin (means fucking, as an expletive)

118.speaker: Player
118.context: NodeContext: slow down the speech a little, as if she's talking to someone stupid.

122.speaker: Player
122.context: NodeContext: slow down the speech a little, as if she's talking to someone stupid.

126.speaker: Player
126.context: NodeContext: slow down the speech a little, as if she's talking to someone stupid.

14.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
14.context: NodeContext: slow down the speech a little, as if she's talking to someone stupid.

121.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
121.context: NodeContext: slow down the speech a little, as if she's talking to someone stupid.

25.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
25.text: Poorly, obviously. Tunnel collapsed on a True Soul. Absolute's going to eat my liver.

76.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
76.text: Now move. I've got no time for -

1.text: That's not what the lookout told me. Hand 'em over, or I'll take them off your corpse.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld between Thrinn and the player

88.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
88.text: That's not what the lookout told me. Hand 'em over, or I'll take them off your corpse.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld between Thrinn and the player

101.speaker: Player
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld between Thrinn and the player

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You think your boss will be happy you attacked a True Soul?
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld between Thrinn and the player

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *The parasite stirs, but it's a mere tickle. You hear no thoughts or memories, just an echo of scars that never healed.*
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld between Thrinn and the player

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *Ancestral memories haunt your mind. Your people were once mind flayer slaves, and still carry the remnants of their illithid powers.*
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld between Thrinn and the player

62.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
62.text: You spoke with him? Then you connected. You are a True Soul.

37.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
37.text: A True Soul, eh? Useless rakkah of a lookout could've told me.

82.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
82.text: Glad you're here to take responsibility. Tunnel's collapsed, trapped True Soul Nere.
82.context: NodeContext: drugning is an expletive (like fucking), pronounced DRUG-ning (g is silent for duergar)

174.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
174.text: He's stuck in there with poisoned geysers. We don't get him out soon, it's both our heads.
174.context: CinematicNodeContext: When Nere mentions Nere is stuck, show cave-in with gnomes digging in front of it.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: It is Nere's head that concerns us.
54.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: It is Nere's head that concerns us.
94.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

142.speaker: Shadowheart
142.text: Not the head we'd like to see roll, unfortunately...
142.context: NodeContext: Discreet reference to Nere, whose head we're to collect as a bounty.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: What is it with these people and heads? Let's get Nere's and get out.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn puts on the boots, then stands.

140.speaker: Player
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn puts on the boots, then stands.

47.speaker: Player
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn puts on the boots, then stands.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Bare feet, I see. I nabbed these boots from a runaway gnome - yours, perhaps?
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn puts on the boots, then stands.

165.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
165.text: Crafty little shits, these ones. You need a stiff cane to keep 'em in line.
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn puts on the boots, then stands.

59.speaker: Player
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

19.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
19.text: Place is older than bonedust. Previous tenants left a trap - dropped a shit-tonne of metal once we'd dug a ways in.

57.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
57.text: Get Nere out and you'll have the Absolute's blessing, no doubting that.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: What are you hoping to find at this dig?
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

75.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
75.text: Entrance to an ancient temple. General's orders, Nere said. Must contain somethin' important.

166.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
166.text: He got me to recruit nonbelievers. But not everyone's seein' the Absolute's truth.

33.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
33.text: They don't get paid soon, I'll have a riot on my hands.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Clearing that rubble will be no easy feat. Any ideas?
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

49.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
49.text: Not a one - unless you count tacking aboleth fangs to my whipping cane.

111.speaker: Player
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

50.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
50.text: Thought you would. True Souls don't abandon their own.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I've got some explosive powder. That should do the trick.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

8.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
8.text: That so? Set it near the rubble and ignite it. That'll blow the drow out.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Sounds like you have a tough job ahead of you. Better hurry.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

160.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
160.text: You gonna just leave him in there to choke? Shit.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

89.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
89.text: On the double ya pricks, before I carve my name into your arses.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed  to gnomes digging at the cave-in.

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: No need for that - Nere's is the only head that matters to us.
150.context: NodeContext: Forced levity - a side-glance at the player referencing that we're actually here to kill Nere, not save him.

95.speaker: Wyll
95.text: Let's all keep our heads, eh? You, us... Nere.
95.context: NodeContext: Forced levity - a side-glance at the player referencing that we're actually here to kill Nere, not save him.

144.speaker: Gale
144.text: The famous Nere - subject of the myconids' ire, no?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: A slave stole them. I'm searching for the culprit.

56.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
56.text: Then find the thievin' bugger and get them back.

34.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
34.text: Then find the thievin' bugger and get them back.

123.text: I'm no fool, jargh. Hand 'em over, or I'll bring the Absolute's fury.

171.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
171.text: I'm no fool, jargh. Hand 'em over, or I'll bring the Absolute's fury.

35.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
35.text: Move, hoon. I don't have time for drugnin' outsiders.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: 'hoon' means outside, pronounced as it is spelledr. DRUG-nin (means fucking, as an expletive)

159.speaker: Player
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn accepts boots. No need to show in cinematic - since she is already holding the cane.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Bare feet, I see. I nabbed these boots from a runaway gnome - yours, perhaps?
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn accepts boots. No need to show in cinematic - since she is already holding the cane.

17.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
17.text: Never thought I'd see these back. Nasty sneak gave even Gekh the slip.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrinn accepts boots. No need to show in cinematic - since she is already holding the cane.

67.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reward given. Could show Thrinn leaning forward to player, but no need for cinematic to show the reward being given otherwise.NodeContext: neutral - she might know we're a True Soul or not, so shouldn't be jarringly aggressive or sycophantic. Just closing one matter and moving onto the next.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I was told to report to you. Gekh Coal is dead.

73.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
73.text: Dead? Drugnin' Gekh - figured I could count on him. Lesson damn well learned.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: You better make time for a True Soul.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I had a chat with Nere, and you're in big trouble.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Judging by the sorry state of your dig, you should.

158.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
158.text: I need labour, not bloody advice. If I don't get this rubble clear and free the True Soul, it'll be my head.

36.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
36.text: Didn't realise we were flirting - just be warned, I hear I taste bitter.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Hmph. Not the most sophisticated way of getting what you want from someone, is it?

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Hmph. Not the most sophisticated way of getting what you want from someone, is it?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Hells. How sick must a soul be to take slaves, let alone lash them?

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: Hells. How sick must a soul be to take slaves, let alone lash them?

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Can't wait to pay these bastards back, lick for lick. Just say the word.

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: Can't wait to pay these bastards back, lick for lick. Just say the word.

152.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
152.text: Go on already, ignite the powder!

170.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
170.text: Go on already, ignite the powder!
